citances.sentence: The Court's jurisdiction does not extend to a review of the Tribunal's decision on the merits, but is limited to the resolution of the controversy between the parties on questions of law: Webb v Teeling [2009] FCA 1094 at [4] ; Flexiplan Australia Ltd v Pankhurst [2001] FCA 1535 (" Flexiplan ") at [5]; TNT Skypak International (Aust) Pty Ltd v FCT [1988] FCA 119 ; (1988) 82 ALR 175 at 178-182. Questions of Law

In a recent decision of the Federal Court in Webb v Teeling [2009] FCA 1094 (29 September 2009), there was an issue as to whether the Trustee's decision to pay part of a death benefit to the deceased member's mother, who then died before the trustee's final decision, should be set aside. It was decided both by this Tribunal and by the Federal Court, on appeal, that the mother was no longer a financial dependant at the time of the Trustee's final decision because of her earlier death. The trustee's decision was, therefore, set aside.

SUPERANNUATION (RESOLUTION OF COMPLAINTS) ACT 1993
SUPERANNUATION (RESOLUTION OF COMPLAINTS) ACT 1993 - SECT 14 Complaints about decisions of trustees other than decisions to admit persons to life policy funds

SUPERANNUATION (RESOLUTION OF COMPLAINTS) ACT 1993 - SECT 19 Tribunal not to deal with complaint unless the complainant has attempted to have the matter resolved
SUPERANNUATION (RESOLUTION OF COMPLAINTS) ACT 1993 - SECT 37 Tribunal powers--complaints under section 14
